definition: victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle

sentences.english: Do you want to win, Janine?
No combat -ready unit ever passed inspection.
sentences.chinese: 没有打过胜仗的部队总是被检阅。

sentences.english: The King's daughter, Yannenga, always helped him win the battles.
sentences.chinese: 国王的女儿叶尼佳总是为父亲打胜仗助一臂之力。

sentences.english: Soldiers win battle and generals get the credit.
sentences.chinese: 士兵打胜仗，将军得荣誉。

sentences.english: After Zhao implemented the reform, the army's fighting capacity was strengthened and won battles one after the other.
sentences.chinese: 赵国实行改革后，军队的战斗力加强了，连连打胜仗。
这样的球队能打胜仗吗？

sentences.english: The enemy expended all their bullets on trying to win the battle.
sentences.chinese: 敌人为了打胜仗，耗尽了全部弹药。

sentences.english: As we know that an army without discipline won't win a war.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，没有纪律的军队不能打胜仗。
启禀将军，我们又打了个胜仗。

sentences.english: But courage and religious faith alone are not enough to win battles.
sentences.chinese: 但是单凭勇气和宗教信仰要打胜仗还是不够的。

sentences.english: We are winning the popular vote.
sentences.chinese: 我们在普选票数方面打了胜仗。

sentences.english: No inspection -ready unit ever passed combat.
sentences.chinese: 没有被检阅过的部队总是打胜仗。

sentences.english: They resisted desperately and won the battle.
sentences.chinese: 他们拼命抵抗，终于打了胜仗。

sentences.english: Originally this book was mainly used to help commanders to win victories in wars.
sentences.chinese: 原来这本书主要是用来帮助指挥官在战争打胜仗。

definition: weaponry/to hold (a weapon)/to wield/to rely on/to depend on/war/battle
to lose a war/fig. the loser (in a competition or election)
to defeat/to inflict a defeat on sb
to fight a battle/to go to war
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to lead military operations with extraordinary skill
to send armed forces to suppress
to be utterly defeated/to be routed
